poem:
**A Winter's Tale**

A nation's lost in fevered haze,  
as coughs and echoes fill the air;  
the corridors of care, a maze,  
each patient waits on tender care.  

Where doctors draw their weary breath,  
and healing hands meet stern demand,  
the hope is for the flu to ebb,  
while voices rise, united, stand.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Tell us: how are you being affected by the rise in UK flu cases? Flu cases rose 55% in one week in England this month, as the NHS braces for a “worst-case scenario” in the next fortnight as hospitals, GP surgeries and ambulances services come under intense strain. It comes as the British Medical Association has lined up strike action for resident doctors in England next week over concerns on pay. We want to hear". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
